Detailed Description

Particle class.

note: reference a particle by pointer or adress never reference a particle directly!

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Particle::Particle ( Initiation &  ini  ) 

a particle constructur for empty particles

  • copy properties from initiation

  • set up phase field

Particle::Particle ( Vec2d  position,
Vec2d  velocity,
double  density,
double  pressure,
double  temperature,
Material &  material 
)

construct a real particle NOTE the particle mass and volume will be specified in initiation::VolumeMass(w)

  • increase the total particle number

  • give a new ID number

  • point to the material properties

  • set viscosity

  • set particle position

  • set states

  • set conservative values and their intermediate values

  • set up phase field

Here is the call graph for this function:

Particle::Particle ( double  x,
double  y,
double  u,
double  v,
double  distance,
double  normal_x,
double  normal_y,
Material &  material 
)

construct a wall particle

  • give a new ID number

  • point to the material properties

  • set particle position

  • set states

  • set distance and normal directions to boundary

  • set states value to avoid error

Particle::Particle ( Particle &  RealParticle  ) 

ghost particle creator

  • give a new ID number

  • point to its real particle

  • point to the material properties

  • set viscosity

  • set states

  • set conservative values and their intermediate values

  • set up phase field

Particle::Particle ( Particle &  RealParticle,
Material &  material 
)

Mirror image particle creator.

  • give a new ID number

  • point to its real particle

  • point to the material properties

  • set viscosity

  • set states

  • set conservative values and their intermediate values

  • set up phase field

Particle::~Particle (  ) 

deconstructor particle

  • delete phase field

  • delete pahse field gradient matrix

Member Function Documentation

void Particle::StatesCopier ( Particle &  RealParticle,
int  type 
)

particle states copier for boundary particles

  • copy states

  • set phase field (depending on boundary type: periodic/wall)

Here is the caller graph for this function:

Member Data Documentation

int Particle::bd

boundary particle or not

  • 0: inside the boundary
  • 1: on the boundary

int Particle::bd_type

boundary type if bd = 1

  • 0 wall particle with zero or constant velocity but never move its position
  • 1 ghost particle for perodic boundary

Vec2d Particle::del_phi

phase field matrix!!!Question!!! first as phase field gradient matrix !!!Question!!! then the independent values ([0][0] and [0][1]) of suface stress matrix !!!Question!!!

long Particle::ID

ID number.

  • a real particle has a unique positive ID
  • a wall particle has zero ID
  • an ghost particle (for perodic boundary condition) has a negtive ID of its corresponding real particle
